title: Photos reveal the everyday signs that are unintentionally ironic
text:
If you've ever made a blunder that was obviously avoidable to everyone else, these pictures will be extremely relatable.

Bored Panda rounded up a selection of amusing photographs taken by people, from around the world, who were able to spot the irony in everyday signs and situations.

Many of the images show people or businesses that are doing the opposite of what they said they would be - including a psychic event that was cancelled due to unforeseen circumstances.

While another photo shows a man standing in a supermarket queue waiting to pay for pull ups, while having his own trousers sagging below his bottom.

Bored Panda rounded up a selection of ironic images taken by people from around the world, including a psychic event cancelled due to unforeseen circumstances

One person was pleasantly amused by an inspirational quote about regret that was written on a stone, despite saying 'nothing is written in stone'

Another individual spotted a business that promised to never stop working for its customers, having a sign in its door revealing they are no longer in service

A number of motorbikes parked outside a Domino's takeaway, were spotted accidentally falling like dominos

One person photographed the irony of a sign with the message 'don't give up', drawn by an artist who failed to finish colouring the illustration

Another individual photographed a spelling mistake on the bar code of an English spelling dictionary on sale in a book shop

A guide titled 'The Best Things In Life Are Free' amused shoppers as it was unreasonably priced at £16.99

One driver appeared to be mocking a sign thanking passersby for driving safely, as they used their car to knock down the signpost

Another vehicle owner failed to park within the lines, despite being labelled 'Advanced Parking Solutions' and advertising a range of services

A retailer offering leggings branded 'Like No Other', amused shoppers as any customer who brought one would be like the other

One Twitter user who tried to boast about their grammar, failed to correctly spell 'you're' in their viral tweet

Another hilarious scenario shows a sign warning drivers to be cautious of cyclists, while filling the entire cycle lane
description: Bored Panda has rounded up a selection of hilarious images of ironic everyday scenarios from around the world, including a spelling mistake on the barcode of a spelling dictionary.
